arduino.move

Class SensorMove

  • java.lang.Object
    • arduino.move.Move
      • arduino.move.ServoMove
        • arduino.move.SensorMove

  • public class SensorMove
extends ServoMove
    This move represents a sensor move.
    Author:
    Jacob Glueck

    • Constructor Detail

      • SensorMove

        public SensorMove(int s,
          int min,
          int max,
          int pt,
          int wt)
        Makes a new sensor move with the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        s - the speed the servo will move at in deg/sec. A negative speed will simply make the servo go backwards.
        min - the minimum light value in the range [0, 1023].
        max - the maximum light value in the range [0, 1023].
        pt - the position threshold in degrees.
        wt - The amount of time, in ms, to wait after the servo has reached its final position.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Description copied from class: Move
        Returns a string that describes the move in accordance with the format in the Arduino - Computer Communication Protocol.
        Specified by:
        toString in class Move
        Returns:
        the move in the format: SEN <speed> <minimum light value threshold> <maximum light value> <position threshold>
